content:
I'm successfully using `le_or_succ_le

But following on my my previous discussion about finding lemmas ...

I typed le_or_succ_le exactly into both loogle and moogle and neither find it.

  • https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=le_or_succ_le
  • https://www.moogle.ai/search/raw?q=le_or_succ_le

I understand the need to improve my ability to use better keywords to aid the search process, but here I'm typing in the exact lemma name.

Any thoughts?

For loogle, it does not work like that. If you want to look for a string which appears in the name of the theorem you have to use "...", as suggested by loogle. The default mode in loogle is pattern matching, stuff like _ ∩ _ = ∅ ↔ _. You can also write the name of a definition like Quotient to find all the entries which mention the term you put.
Also, if you're trying to guess the name of a theorem, sometimes it's worth trying to type it in the search bar of the docs, as it will automatically suggest entries with similar names
How are you using it successfully? It doesn't seem to exist in the docs either

Lean is a language that is still quicky evolving. Mathlib is based on Lean and is itself evolving even more quickly. This means that any resource to teach about either is bound to be out of date fairly quickly.

Heather's course, as far as I can tell, is meant to be an introduction to theorem proving, it uses Lean, it is based heavily on Mathlib, but also diverges from it by design.

Hence, there are tactics and lemmas in Heather's course that are not in mathlib.

For lemmas, if you know the exact name and the docs don't show it, it means it is not in mathlib. No amount of loogling or moogling will find it. Ultimately, these search tools find results in mathlib and its dependencies.

Thanks for explaining it isn't part of mathlib.

For such a simple and fundamental and useful lemma, I suggest it should be?

Ps I did check the "divergence" page to see if it was one of the special ones but it wasnt' there: https://hrmacbeth.github.io/math2001/Mainstream_Lean.html
Agost Biro has marked this topic as resolved.
